name: Little Bangkok Thai Kitchen 2

featured_reviews.review_id:
I've been eyeing this place for a while now and decided to give it a go. My god, was it good.  So good. I ordered the Drunken Noodles with prawns. The prawns were enormous and perfectly cooked. Every flavour was balanced and expertly executed. I will be coming here more often for sure to try the rest of the menu. I had no clue International Village had so many good options in the food court.

The only advice I give is go easy on the spice. I ordered Medium spice with my noodles and, though I could handle it, I'm at the age where the rest of my body is not too keen of a certain threshold of chillies onwards. I will be paying for this level of spice later. But for now, HOT DANG was it delicious.
featured_reviews.review_text:

featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for discovering our tiny house :) we tried our best serve the most authentic Thai cuisine to your table. We used in-house recipe for roasted ground chilli flake to bring out spiciness and aromatic at most ! That's why our spicy is likely what you might experience in Thailand. We meant it, please try customized spicy level and comeback for mores.

featured_reviews.review_id:
This Thai place is located in the upstairs food court at the center.
Papaya salad about CA$10 on medium hot indeed was more spicy than other Thai places.  Thank goodness I can eat hot so no problem there.
The eggplant tofu was good so was egg rolls.

featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for your review and try our foods. Please comeback for more of Thai taste :)

featured_reviews.review_id:
Thank god I tried this place in the food court! It's so authentic and so good!
The padthai is amazing and tastes exactly like what I had in Thailand, the durian sticky rice is also really delicious, such large chunk of durian!

Recommend to all of you who don't know what to eat in this mall

Thank you for sincerely review :) 
We would love to have you again soon. Please comeback and try more "feel-like-home" taste @littlebangkok2

featured_reviews.review_id:
An absolutely delicious choice of food at the cafeteria in the mall. I was looking for a place to eat and the reviews from previous customers had all indicated two things: you should not miss this when your in the area and that the food is authentic as it is in Thailand. I couldn't pass and I agree with the previous customers and enjoyed the service and the food itself. The gentlemen at the cashier was very friendly by greeting me in Thai - it's appreciated.

I ordered the Pad Thai and it was delicious. It had the perfect spice to it and the spring roll was just right. I loved the soup that came with it as it washed down the after taste. Next time I will try their soup and I will come by soon! Thank you for the experience today :)

featured_reviews.review_id: Ordered #4 combo, again ! Cashew stir fried with rice, spring roll, soup, salad & drink, all for $15. Tasty & neatly prepared by this loving Thai family ! I certainly recommend !
featured_reviews.review_text: Ordered #4 combo, again ! Cashew stir fried with rice, spring roll, soup, salad & drink, all for $15. Tasty & neatly prepared by this loving Thai family ! I certainly recommend !
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for coming and enjoy our foods and services! We have more to offers, please come visit us again and try mores of Thai authentic taste :)

featured_reviews.review_id:
Sometimes you find the best food in the most unexpected places. Walking into International Village Mall for the first time, you might be taken aback by how empty and dead it feels, especially in contrast to the surrounding lively Gastown district. But you'd be surprised by how alive the food scene is. Especially this little hidden gem.

We had:

Pad Thai Combo ($14.99 + $2 for choosing prawns) - one of the best I've had, the flavour was a perfect balance of slightly sweet, savoury and a little kick of spice (you can adjust). The combo comes with the following: (1) a salad, (2) a spring roll, (3) a soup, and (4) your choice of a drink. The soup was clean and clear but packed with flavour. It was a clear sign that the chef is talented

Tom Kah Goong (Prawn) ($14.95) - this is very reminiscent of the more popular Tom Yum soup but with the addition of creamy coconut milk. It was piping hot (seriously, be careful!) but I fought through the pain to gulp it down because it was so delicious! Those hot, sour, creamy flavours all melded together into an amazing concoction. Bites of mushroom, lemongrass, tomatoes, onions, and prawns throughout were delightful

The fact that you're getting this level of restaurant-quality (and honestly much better than some restaurants) food in a little place like this is unbelievable. They're the sweetest and they obviously pour so much love into what they do. If you're ever in the area, I hope you'll consider stopping by this hidden food court! While its exterior may not seem particularly extraordinary, it holds some amazing flavours and wonderful people.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Amazing authentic Thai food at accessible prices. Best pad Thai and mango sticky rice I have ever had outside of Thailand. The green curry is rich, satisfying, and has big, strong flavours. Best Thai food in Vancouver is in the food court of International Village Mall. Believe it or not!

This is not fast food because it's only two people (husband and wife) making authentic and amazing Thai food which should not be rushed. Just sit down and get excited about the amazing food you're about to eat.
featured_reviews.review_text:

featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: We are appreciating our kindly understanding about waiting time. We are trying our best to serve fresh and delicious Thai foods for everyone. Glad you enjoy it and please comeback and try for more of Thai Authentic Thai foods.
